descriptions: Modify the user's login access, such as by rejecting the login attempt.
api.access.title: ApiAccess

descriptions:
Mark the current login attempt as denied. This will prevent the end-user
      from completing the login flow. This will NOT cancel other
      user-related side effects (such as metadata changes) requested by this
      Action. The login flow will immediately stop following the completion of 
      this action and no further Actions will be executed.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.access.deny.title: deny
api.access.deny.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. A human-readable explanation for rejecting the
              login. This is sent as error_description to the application that initiated the request.
api.access.deny.reason.title: reason

descriptions: Request changes to the access token being issued.
api.accessToken.title: ApiAccessToken

descriptions:
Set a custom claim on the Access Token that will be issued upon completion
      of the login flow.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.accessToken.setCustomClaim.title: setCustomClaim
api.accessToken.setCustomClaim.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. Name of the claim (note that this may need to be a
              fully-qualified URL).
api.accessToken.setCustomClaim.name.title: name

descriptions: Any value. The value of the claim.
api.accessToken.setCustomClaim.value.title: value

descriptions: Add a scope on the Access Token that will be issued upon completion of the login flow.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.accessToken.addScope.title: addScope
api.accessToken.addScope.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: String The scope to be added.
api.accessToken.addScope.scope.title: scope

descriptions: Remove a scope on the Access Token that will be issued upon completion of the login flow.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.accessToken.removeScope.title: removeScope
api.accessToken.removeScope.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: String The scope to be removed.
api.accessToken.removeScope.scope.title: scope

descriptions: Request changes to the authentication state of the current user's session.
api.authentication.title: ApiAuthentication

descriptions:
Indicate that a custom authentication method has been completed in the
      current session. This method will then be available in the
      `event.authentication.methods` array in subsequent logins.

Important: This API is only available from within the
      onContinuePostLogin function for
      PostLogin Actions. In other words, this may be used to record
      the completion of a custom authentication method after redirecting the user
      via  api.redirect.sendUserTo().
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.authentication.recordMethod.title: recordMethod
api.authentication.recordMethod.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. A url representing the identity of the custom
              authenticated method that was completed.
api.authentication.recordMethod.provider.title: provider_url

descriptions: Challenge the user with one or more specified multifactor authentication factors. This method presents the default challenge first, then allows the user to select a different option if additional factors have been supplied. If the user has not enrolled in any of the factors supplied (including both the default and any additional factors), the command fails.
Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.
api.authentication.challengeWith.title: challengeWith
api.authentication.challengeWith.returnDescription: Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.

descriptions: Object. An object containing the type field. type is a string used to specify the default MFA factor or factors used to challenge the user.
Supported values include:

otp
              recovery-code
              email
              push-notification
                  
                      otpFallbackWhen set to false, the user cannot use the OTP fallback option of the push notification factor. 
                  
              phone
                  
                      preferredMethod: voice
                      preferredMethod: sms
                      preferredMethod: both
              
              webauthn-platform
              webauthn-roaming
Example
api.authentication.challengeWith.factor.title: factor

descriptions: Optional object. An object containing the optional additionalFactors field.
additionalFactors is an array used to specify other factors a user can choose from when completing the MFA challenge. Supports the same values as the type field.
Example
api.authentication.challengeWith.options.title: options

descriptions: Trigger an MFA challenge and allow the user to select their preferred factor from the supplied list. This method presents a factor picker to the user rather than a specific challenge, in accordance with the following conditions:
Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.
api.authentication.challengeWithAny.title: challengeWithAny
api.authentication.challengeWithAny.returnDescription: Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.

descriptions: Array. An array of objects that includes the  type field.  type is a string used to specify an MFA factor the user can choose from when challenged.
Supported values include:

otp
              recovery-code
              email
              push-notification
                  
                      otpFallbackWhen set to false, the user cannot use the OTP fallback option of the push notification factor. 
                  
              phone
                  
                      preferredMethod: voice
                      preferredMethod: sms
                      preferredMethod: both
                  
              webauthn-platform
              webauthn-roaming
api.authentication.challengeWithAny.fact.title: factors

descriptions: Prompt the user to enroll with a specific MFA factor. This method prompts the user to enroll with a default factor, but can optionally allow the user to select a different option if additional factors have been supplied. If the user has already enrolled in all of the supplied factors (including both the default value and any additional factors), the command fails.
Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.
api.authentication.enrollWith.title: enrollWith
api.authentication.enrollWith.returnDescription: Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.

descriptions: Object. An object containing the type field. type is a string used to specify the default MFA factor the user is prompted to enroll.
Supported values include:

otp
              recovery-code
              push-notification
              phone
                 
                   preferredMethod: voice
                   preferredMethod: sms
                   preferredMethod: both
                 
              webauthn-platform
              webauthn-roaming
api.authentication.enrollWith.factor.title: factor

descriptions: Optional object. An object containing the optional additionalFactors field.
additionalFactors is an array used to specify other factors a user can choose from during enrollment. Supports the same values as the type field.
Example
Example
api.authentication.enrollWith.options.title: options

descriptions: Prompt the user to select an MFA factor to enroll in from the supplied list. This method presents a factor picker to the user rather than a default factor prompt, in accordance with the following conditions:
Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.
api.authentication.enrollWithAny.title: enrollWithAny
api.authentication.enrollWithAny.returnDescription: Note: This method overrides existing policies and rules that enable or disable MFA in a tenant.

descriptions: Array. An array of objects that includes the  type field.  type is a string used to specify the default MFA factor the user is prompted to enroll.
Supported values include:

otp
              recovery-code
              push-notification
              phone
                   
                      preferredMethod: voice
                      preferredMethod: sms
                      preferredMethod: both
                  
              webauthn-platform
              webauthn-roaming
api.authentication.enrollWithAny.factors.title: factors

descriptions: Change the primary user for the login transaction.

In scenarios that require linking users, the user identity used to initiate the login may no longer exist as a discrete user. That identity may now be a secondary identity of an existing user. In such situations, the setPrimaryUser() function can be used to indicate that the subject of the login should be changed.
Important:
api.authentication.setPrimaryUser.title: setPrimaryUser

descriptions: String. The user ID of the user for whom tokens should be issued (the sub claim).
api.authentication.setPrimaryUser.primar.title: primary_user_id

descriptions: Store and retrieve data that persists across executions.
api.cache.title: ApiCache

descriptions: Delete a record describing a cached value at the supplied key if it exists.

Returns a CacheWriteResult object with  type: "success" if a value was removed from the cache. A failed operation returns type: "error". For errors, the returned object will have a
      code property that indicates the nature of the failure.
api.cache.delete.title: delete
api.cache.delete.returnDescription:
Returns a CacheWriteResult object with  type: "success" if a value was removed from the cache. A failed operation returns type: "error". For errors, the returned object will have a
      code property that indicates the nature of the failure.

descriptions: String. The key of the record stored in the cache.
api.cache.delete.key.title: key

descriptions:
Retrieve a record describing a cached value at the supplied
      key, if it exists. If a record is found, the cached value can
      be found at the value property of the returned object.

Returns a cache record if an item is found in the cache for the supplied
      key. Cache records are objects with a
      value property holding the cached value as well as an
      expires_at property indicating the maximum expiry of
      the record in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.

Important:
      This cache is designed for short-lived, ephemeral data. Items may not be
      available in later transactions even if they are within their supplied their
      lifetime.
api.cache.get.title: get
api.cache.get.returnDescription:
Important:
      This cache is designed for short-lived, ephemeral data. Items may not be
      available in later transactions even if they are within their supplied their
      lifetime.

descriptions: String. The key of the record stored in the cache.
api.cache.get.key.title: key

descriptions: Store or update a string value in the cache at the specified key.

Values stored in this cache are scoped to the Trigger in which they are set.
      They are subject to the
      Actions Cache Limits.

Values stored in this way will have lifetimes of up to the specified
      ttl or expires_at values. If no lifetime is
      specified, a default lifetime of 15 minutes will be used. Lifetimes may
      not exceed the maximum duration listed at
      Actions Cache Limits.
Returns CacheWriteSuccess if the values are stored successfully. Otherwise, you will receive CacheWriteError.
api.cache.set.title: set

descriptions: String. The key of the record stored in the cache.
api.cache.set.key.title: key

descriptions: String. The value of the record to be stored.
api.cache.set.value.title: value

descriptions: Optional object. Options for adjusting cache behavior.
api.cache.set.options.title: options

descriptions:
Optional number. The absolute expiry time in milliseconds
              since the unix epoch. While cached records may be evicted earlier,
              they will never remain beyond the the supplied
              expires_at.

Note: This value should not be supplied if a value was also
              provided for ttl. If both options are supplied, the
              earlier expiry of the two will be used.
api.cache.set.options.expires_at.title: ApiCacheSetOptionsExpires_at

descriptions:
Optional number. The time-to-live value of this cache entry
              in milliseconds. While cached values may be evicted earlier, they
              will never remain beyond the the supplied ttl.

Note: This value should not be supplied if a value was also
              provided for expires_at. If both options are supplied,
              the earlier expiry of the two will be used.
api.cache.set.options.ttl.title: ApiCacheSetOptionsTtl

descriptions: Request changes to the ID token being issued.
api.idToken.title: ApiIdToken

descriptions:
Set a custom claim on the ID token that will be issued upon completion of
      the login flow.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.idToken.setCustomClaim.title: setCustomClaim
api.idToken.setCustomClaim.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. Name of the claim (note that this may need to be a
              fully-qualified URL).
api.idToken.setCustomClaim.name.title: name

descriptions: Any value. The value of the claim.
api.idToken.setCustomClaim.value.title: value

descriptions: Set the requirement for multifactor authentication on the login attempt.
api.multifactor.title: ApiMultifactor

descriptions:
Enable multifactor authentication for this login flow. When enabled, users
      must complete the configured multifactor challenge. The actual multifactor
      challenge will be deferred to the end of the login flow.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.multifactor.enable.title: enable
api.multifactor.enable.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. The name of the multifactor provider to use or the
              value any to use any of the configured providers.
Supported values include:

any Use any of the configured challenges.
              duo Use the Duo multifactor provider.
              
                google-authenticator Use the Google Authenticator
                provider.
              
              guardian Use the Guardian provider.
              none Use none of the configured challenges to prevent the MFA flow from triggering.
api.multifactor.enable.provider.title: provider

descriptions:
Optional object. Additional options for enabling
              multifactor challenges.
api.multifactor.enable.options.title: options

descriptions: Optional boolean. When provider is set to google-authenticator or duo, the user is prompted for MFA once every 30 days. When provider is set to guardian, the MFA prompt displays the enrollment checkbox for users to choose whether or not to enroll. Defaults to false. To learn more, read Customize Multi-Factor Authentication Pages
api.multifactor.enable.options.allowReme.title: ApiMultifactorEnableOptionsAllowRememberBrowser

descriptions:
Optional object. Additional options to configure the
              challenge, only available for the duo provider.
Supported options include:

host String. This is the API hostname value
                from your Duo account.
              
              
                ikey String. This is the Client ID
                (previously Integration key) value from your Duo account.
              
              
                skey String. This is the Client secret
                (previously Secret key) value from your Duo account.
              
              
                username Optional string. Use some attribute
                of the profile as the username in DuoSecurity. This is also useful
                if you already have your users enrolled in Duo.
api.multifactor.enable.options.providerO.title: ApiMultifactorEnableOptionsProviderOptions

descriptions:
Make application-specific changes to the metadata of the user that is
      logging in.

NOTE: Invoking these methods does not update the metadata immediately. You
          can call them several times throughout multiple Actions of the same flow,
          and the engine will aggregate the changes and update the metadata at
          once before the flow is completed.
api.user.title: ApiUser

descriptions:
Set application metadata for the user that is logging in. Data stored within
      app_metadata is not editable by the user.   Note: This trigger makes a call to the Management API, consuming the Management API rate limit. If this request hits the rate limit and fails to retry within the timeout window, you will receive a Deadline Exceeded error.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.user.setAppMetadata.title: setAppMetadata
api.user.setAppMetadata.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: String. The name of metadata property.
api.user.setAppMetadata.name.title: name

descriptions:
Any value. The value of the metadata property. This may be
              set to null to remove the metadata property.
api.user.setAppMetadata.value.title: value

descriptions: Set general metadata for the user that is logging in.  Note: This trigger makes a call to the Management API, consuming the Management API rate limit. If this request hits the rate limit and fails to retry within the timeout window, you will receive a Deadline Exceeded error.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.user.setUserMetadata.title: setUserMetadata
api.user.setUserMetadata.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: String. The name of metadata property.
api.user.setUserMetadata.name.title: name

descriptions:
Any value. The value of the metadata property. This may be
              set to null to remove the metadata property.
api.user.setUserMetadata.value.title: value

descriptions:
Create a session token suitable for using as a query string parameter
        redirect target (via sendUserTo) that contains data whose
        authenticity must be provable by the target endpoint. The target endpoint
        can verify the authenticity and integrity of the data by checking the
        JWT's signature using a shared secret.
Returns a JWT string.
api.redirect.encodeToken.title: encodeToken

descriptions:
Options. Configure how sensitive data is encoded into the
                query parameters of the resulting url.
api.redirect.encodeToken.options.title: options

descriptions:
Number. Number of seconds before this token will expire
                (defaults to 900).
api.redirect.encodeToken.options.expires.title: ApiRedirectEncodeTokenOptionsExpiresInSeconds

descriptions:
Options. The data intended to be passed to the target of
                the redirect and whose authenticity and integrity must be
                provable.
api.redirect.encodeToken.options.payload.title: ApiRedirectEncodeTokenOptionsPayload

descriptions:
String. A secret that will be used to sign a JWT that is
                shared with the redirect target. The secret value should be stored
                as a secret and retrieved using
                event.secrets['SECRET_NAME'].
api.redirect.encodeToken.options.secret.title: ApiRedirectEncodeTokenOptionsSecret

descriptions:
Trigger a browser redirect to the target `url` immediately after this
        action completes.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.redirect.sendUserTo.title: sendUserTo
api.redirect.sendUserTo.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: String. The url in which to redirect the user.
api.redirect.sendUserTo.url.title: url

descriptions:
Options. An object representing additional query string
                parameters that should be appended to the redirect URL.
api.redirect.sendUserTo.options.title: options

descriptions:
Options. Additional query string parameters that should
                be appended to the redirect URL.
api.redirect.sendUserTo.options.query.title: ApiRedirectSendUserToOptionsQuery

descriptions:
Retrieve the data encoded in a JWT token passed to the
        /continue endpoint while verifying the authenticity and
        integrity of that data.
Returns payload of the JWT token.
api.redirect.validateToken.title: validateToken
api.redirect.validateToken.returnDescription: Returns payload of the JWT token.

descriptions:
Options. Options for retrieving the data encoded in a JWT
                token passed to the /continue endpoint following a
                redirect.
api.redirect.validateToken.options.title: options

descriptions: String. Secret used to encode the token.
api.redirect.validateToken.options.secre.title: ApiRedirectValidateTokenOptionsSecret

descriptions:
String. The name of the query or body parameter that was
                sent to the /continue endpoint. (defaults to
                session_token
api.redirect.validateToken.options.token.title: ApiRedirectValidateTokenOptionsTokenParameterName

descriptions: Get information about the Rules that have run during the current transaction.
api.rules.title: ApiRules

descriptions: Check whether a specific Rule has been executed prior to this Action in the current transaction. This can be used to avoid running logic that has been duplicated from that Rule into this Action during migration to Actions.
This method returns true when the Rule with the provided ID has been executed in this transaction and false when it has not..
api.rules.wasExecuted.title: wasExecuted
api.rules.wasExecuted.returnDescription: This method returns true when the Rule with the provided ID has been executed in this transaction and false when it has not..

descriptions: String. The Rule ID to check.
api.rules.wasExecuted.ruleId.title: ruleId

descriptions: Modify the SAML Response for the user that is logging in.
api.samlResponse.title: ApiSamlResponse

descriptions: Set a custom SAML attribute.

A failed operation throws an Error. For errors, the returned
    object has a message that indicates the nature of the failure.

The value must be of type SAMLValue, which can be
    string | number | boolean | null | Array
api.samlResponse.setAttribute.title: setAttribute
api.samlResponse.setAttribute.returnDescription:
The value must be of type SAMLValue, which can be
    string | number | boolean | null | Array

descriptions: String. The SAML attribute to be set.
api.samlResponse.setAttribute.attribute.title: attribute

descriptions:
SAMLValue. The value of the SAML assertion. This may be set
            to null to remove the attribute property.
api.samlResponse.setAttribute.value.title: value

descriptions:
Alter the audience of the SAML Response. Default is the issuer on
    SAMLRequest.
api.samlResponse.setAudience.title: setAudience
api.samlResponse.setAudience.returnDescription:
Alter the audience of the SAML Response. Default is the issuer on
    SAMLRequest.

descriptions: String. The SAML audience to be set.
api.samlResponse.setAudience.audience.title: audience

descriptions: Alter the issuer of the SAML Response. Default issuer is urn:TENANT.
api.samlResponse.setIssuer.title: setIssuer
api.samlResponse.setIssuer.returnDescription: Alter the issuer of the SAML Response. Default issuer is urn:TENANT.

descriptions: String. The SAML issuer to be set.
api.samlResponse.setIssuer.issuer.title: issuer

descriptions:
Optionally specify a public key used to encrypt the SAML assertion. The
    public key should be obtained from the service provider. Both the public key
    and certificate must be specified.
api.samlResponse.setEncryptionPublicKey.title: setEncryptionPublicKey
api.samlResponse.setEncryptionPublicKey.returnDescription:
Optionally specify a public key used to encrypt the SAML assertion. The
    public key should be obtained from the service provider. Both the public key
    and certificate must be specified.

descriptions: String. The public key to be set.
api.samlResponse.setEncryptionPublicKey..title: publicKey

descriptions:
Alter the recipient of the SAML assertion (SubjectConfirmationData). Default
    is AssertionConsumerUrl on SAMLRequest or callback
    URL if no SAMLRequest was sent.
api.samlResponse.setRecipient.title: setRecipient
api.samlResponse.setRecipient.returnDescription:
Alter the recipient of the SAML assertion (SubjectConfirmationData). Default
    is AssertionConsumerUrl on SAMLRequest or callback
    URL if no SAMLRequest was sent.

descriptions: String. The SAML recipient to be set.
api.samlResponse.setRecipient.recipient.title: recipient

descriptions: Dictates if a UPN claim should be created. Default is true.
api.samlResponse.setCreateUpnClaim.title: setCreateUpnClaim
api.samlResponse.setCreateUpnClaim.returnDescription: Dictates if a UPN claim should be created. Default is true.

descriptions: Boolean Toggle to create a UPN claim.
api.samlResponse.setCreateUpnClaim.creat.title: createUpnClaim

descriptions:
If true (default), for each claim that is not mapped to the
    common profile, Auth0 passes through those in the output assertion. If
    false, those claims won't be mapped.
api.samlResponse.setPassthroughClaimsWit.title: setPassthroughClaimsWithNoMapping
api.samlResponse.setPassthroughClaimsWit.returnDescription:
If true (default), for each claim that is not mapped to the
    common profile, Auth0 passes through those in the output assertion. If
    false, those claims won't be mapped.

descriptions:
Boolean Should claims should be mapped to the output
            assertion.
api.samlResponse.setPassthroughClaimsWit.title: passthroughClaimsWithNoMapping

descriptions:
If passthroughClaimsWithNoMapping is true and this
    is false (default), for each claim not mapped to the common
    profile Auth0 adds a prefix http://schema.auth0.com. If true,
    it will pass through the claim as-is.
api.samlResponse.setMapUnknownClaimsAsIs.title: setMapUnknownClaimsAsIs
api.samlResponse.setMapUnknownClaimsAsIs.returnDescription:
If passthroughClaimsWithNoMapping is true and this
    is false (default), for each claim not mapped to the common
    profile Auth0 adds a prefix http://schema.auth0.com. If true,
    it will pass through the claim as-is.

descriptions: Boolean Should claims should be mapped as-is.
api.samlResponse.setMapUnknownClaimsAsIs.title: mapUnknownClaimsAsIs

descriptions:
If true (default), this adds more information in the token such
    as the provider (Google, ADFS, AD, etc.) and the access token, if available
api.samlResponse.setMapIdentities.title: setMapIdentities
api.samlResponse.setMapIdentities.returnDescription:
If true (default), this adds more information in the token such
    as the provider (Google, ADFS, AD, etc.) and the access token, if available

descriptions: Boolean Should identities be mapped.
api.samlResponse.setMapIdentities.mapIde.title: mapIdentities

descriptions:
Destination of the SAML response. If not specified, it will be
    AssertionConsumerUrl of SAMLRequest or callback URL if there was no
    SAMLRequest.
api.samlResponse.setDestination.title: setDestination
api.samlResponse.setDestination.returnDescription:
Destination of the SAML response. If not specified, it will be
    AssertionConsumerUrl of SAMLRequest or callback URL if there was no
    SAMLRequest.

descriptions: String Destination of the SAML response.
api.samlResponse.setDestination.destinat.title: destination

descriptions: Alter the RelayState of the SAML response. Default is RelayState on SAMLRequest.
api.samlResponse.setRelayState.title: setRelayState
api.samlResponse.setRelayState.returnDescription: Alter the RelayState of the SAML response. Default is RelayState on SAMLRequest.

descriptions: String RelayState of the SAML response.
api.samlResponse.setRelayState.relayStat.title: relayState

descriptions:
Expiration of the token in seconds. Default is 3600 seconds (1
    hour).
api.samlResponse.setLifetimeInSeconds.title: setLifetimeInSeconds
api.samlResponse.setLifetimeInSeconds.returnDescription:
Expiration of the token in seconds. Default is 3600 seconds (1
    hour).

descriptions: Number Expiration of the token in seconds.
api.samlResponse.setLifetimeInSeconds.li.title: lifetimeInSeconds

descriptions:
Whether or not the SAML response should be signed. By default the SAML
    assertion will be signed, but not the SAML response. If true,
    SAML Response will be signed instead of SAML assertion. Default to
    false.
api.samlResponse.setSignResponse.title: setSignResponse
api.samlResponse.setSignResponse.returnDescription:
Whether or not the SAML response should be signed. By default the SAML
    assertion will be signed, but not the SAML response. If true,
    SAML Response will be signed instead of SAML assertion. Default to
    false.

descriptions: Boolean Should the SAML response be signed.
api.samlResponse.setSignResponse.signRes.title: signResponse

descriptions:
Sets the name ID format. Default is
    urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified.
api.samlResponse.setNameIdentifierFormat.title: setNameIdentifierFormat
api.samlResponse.setNameIdentifierFormat.returnDescription:
Sets the name ID format. Default is
    urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified.

descriptions: String The Name ID Format.
api.samlResponse.setNameIdentifierFormat.title: nameIdentifierFormat

descriptions:
Auth0 tries to name each of the attributes of this array in order. If one of
them has a value, it will use that for the Subject/NameID. The order is:
api.samlResponse.setNameIdentifierProbes.title: setNameIdentifierProbes
api.samlResponse.setNameIdentifierProbes.returnDescription:
Auth0 tries to name each of the attributes of this array in order. If one of
them has a value, it will use that for the Subject/NameID. The order is:

descriptions:
String array An array of attributes to try for the name
            identifier.
api.samlResponse.setNameIdentifierProbes.title: nameIdentifierProbes

descriptions: Default is urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:ac:classes:unspecified.
api.samlResponse.setAuthnContextClassRef.title: setAuthnContextClassRef

descriptions: String The AuthnContextClassRef.
api.samlResponse.setAuthnContextClassRef.title: authnContextClassRef

descriptions:
Optionally indicates the public key certificate used to validate SAML
    requests. If set, SAML requests will be required to be signed. A sample
    value would be
    "-----BEGIN
      CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n".
api.samlResponse.setSigningCert.title: setSigningCert
api.samlResponse.setSigningCert.returnDescription:
Optionally indicates the public key certificate used to validate SAML
    requests. If set, SAML requests will be required to be signed. A sample
    value would be
    "-----BEGIN
      CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n".

descriptions:
String Optional public key certificate used to validate
            SAML requests.
api.samlResponse.setSigningCert.signingC.title: signingCert

descriptions:
When set to true, we infer the NameFormat based on the
    attribute name. NameFormat values are
    urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri,
    urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:basic and
    urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:unspecified.

If set to false, the attribute NameFormat is not set in the
    assertion. Default is true.
api.samlResponse.setIncludeAttributeName.title: setIncludeAttributeNameFormat
api.samlResponse.setIncludeAttributeName.returnDescription:
If set to false, the attribute NameFormat is not set in the
    assertion. Default is true.

descriptions:
BooleanShould NameFormat be inferred based on the attribute
            name.
api.samlResponse.setIncludeAttributeName.title: includeAttributeNameFormat

descriptions:
When set to true, we infer the xs:type of the
    element. Types are xs:string, xs:boolean,
    xs:double and xs:anyType. When set to
    false all xs:type are xs:anyType.
    Default is true.
api.samlResponse.setTypedAttributes.title: setTypedAttributes
api.samlResponse.setTypedAttributes.returnDescription:
When set to true, we infer the xs:type of the
    element. Types are xs:string, xs:boolean,
    xs:double and xs:anyType. When set to
    false all xs:type are xs:anyType.
    Default is true.

descriptions: BooleanShould xs:type be inferred.
api.samlResponse.setTypedAttributes.type.title: typedAttributes

descriptions:
Optionally specify a certificate used to encrypt the SAML assertion. The
    certificate should be obtained from the service provider. Both the
    certificate and public key must be specified. A sample value would be
    "-----BEGIN
      CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n".
api.samlResponse.setEncryptionCert.title: setEncryptionCert
api.samlResponse.setEncryptionCert.returnDescription:
Optionally specify a certificate used to encrypt the SAML assertion. The
    certificate should be obtained from the service provider. Both the
    certificate and public key must be specified. A sample value would be
    "-----BEGIN
      CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n".

descriptions: StringOptional certificate to encrypt the SAML assertion.
api.samlResponse.setEncryptionCert.encry.title: encryptionCert

descriptions:
By default, Auth0 will use the private/public key pair assigned to your
    tenant to sign SAML responses or assertions. For very specific scenarios,
    you might wish to provide your own certificate and private key.
Both the certificate and private key must be specified.

A sample value would be
    "-----BEGIN
      CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n".
api.samlResponse.setCert.title: setCert
api.samlResponse.setCert.returnDescription:
A sample value would be
    "-----BEGIN
      CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n".

descriptions:
StringOptional certificate to sign the SAML responses or
            assertions.
api.samlResponse.setCert.cert.title: cert

descriptions:
By default, Auth0 will use the private/public key pair assigned to your
    tenant to sign SAML responses or assertions. For very specific scenarios,
    you might wish to provide your own certificate and private key.

Since this private key is sensitive, we recommend using the
    Add Secret functionality of Actions. See here for more details: Write
    Your First Action
Both the certificate and private key must be specified.

A sample value would be
    "-----BEGIN PRIVATE
      KEY-----\nnMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END PRIVATE KEY-----\n".
api.samlResponse.setKey.title: setKey
api.samlResponse.setKey.returnDescription:
A sample value would be
    "-----BEGIN PRIVATE
      KEY-----\nnMIIC8jCCAdqgAwIBAgIJObB6jmhG0QIEMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMCAxHjAcBgNV\n[..all
      the other lines..]-----END PRIVATE KEY-----\n".

descriptions:
StringOptional private key to sign the SAML responses or
            assertions.
api.samlResponse.setKey.key.title: key

descriptions: Deprecated: Default is rsa-sha256
api.samlResponse.setSignatureAlgorithm.title: setSignatureAlgorithm

descriptions:
rsa-sha256 | rsa-sha1.
            rsa-sha1 should not be used. This is insecure.
api.samlResponse.setSignatureAlgorithm.s.title: signatureAlgorithm

descriptions: Deprecated: Default is sha256
api.samlResponse.setDigestAlgorithm.title: setDigestAlgorithm

descriptions:
sha256 | sha1.
            rsa-sha1 should not be used. This is insecure.
api.samlResponse.setDigestAlgorithm.dige.title: digestAlgorithm

descriptions: Manage sessions, such as by revoking a user session.
api.session.title: ApiSession

descriptions:
Reject the current transaction, revoke the session, and delete associated
    refresh tokens. This will prevent the user from completing the flow and no
    further Actions are executed.

Note This method initiates a session-revoked
    OIDC Back-Channel Logout Initiator
    
    to logout users from all applications bound to the current session. Deletion
    of session associated refresh tokens is an asynchronous operation.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.session.revoke.title: revoke
api.session.revoke.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. A human-readable explanation for rejecting the
            login. This is sent as error_description to the application that
            initiated the request.
api.session.revoke.reason.title: reason

descriptions:
preserveRefreshTokens. is a boolean used to specify if
            revoke will preserve the refresh tokens bound to the session with
            the same session_id. Defaults to false.
Example

api.session.revoke('reason', 
             {'preserveRefreshTokens':true} );Was this helpful?Yes /No
api.session.revoke.options.title: options

descriptions: Set a new absolute expiration date for a specified session.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.session.setExpiresAt.title: setExpiresAt
api.session.setExpiresAt.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: Number. The absolute expiry time in milliseconds since the unix epoch.
api.session.setExpiresAt.absolute.title: absolute

descriptions: Set a new inactivity expiration date for a specified session.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.session.setIdleExpiresAt.title: setIdleExpiresAt
api.session.setIdleExpiresAt.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: Number. The inactivity expiry time in milliseconds since the unix epoch.

This method sets the session inactivity timeout for the current interaction. If the method is not reapplied, subsequent successful interactions will override the inactivity timeout using the session inactivity timeout settings.
api.session.setIdleExpiresAt.idle.title: idle

descriptions: Manage refresh tokens, such as by revoking a refresh token.
api.refreshToken.title: ApiRefreshToken

descriptions:
Reject the current token exchange and revoke the refresh token. This will
    prevent the user from completing the flow and no further Actions are
    executed.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.refreshToken.revoke.title: revoke
api.refreshToken.revoke.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions:
String. A human-readable explanation for rejecting the
            refresh token. This is sent as error_description to the application
            that initiated the request.
api.refreshToken.revoke.reason.title: reason

descriptions: Set a new absolute expiration date for a specified refresh token.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.refreshToken.setExpiresAt.title: setExpiresAt
api.refreshToken.setExpiresAt.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: Number. The absolute expiry time in milliseconds since the unix epoch.
api.refreshToken.setExpiresAt.absolute.title: absolute

descriptions: Set a new inactivity expiration date  for a specified refresh token.
Returns a reference to the api object.
api.refreshToken.setIdleExpiresAt.title: setIdleExpiresAt
api.refreshToken.setIdleExpiresAt.returnDescription: Returns a reference to the api object.

descriptions: Number. The inactivity expiry time in milliseconds since the unix epoch.

This method sets the refresh token inactivity timeout for the current interaction. If the method is not reapplied, subsequent successful interactions will override the inactivity timeout using the refresh token inactivity timeout settings.
api.refreshToken.setIdleExpiresAt.idle.title: idle
